medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced abnormal thyroid hormone levels at age 3. He had sleep difficulties, hyperactive behavior, and voracious appetite but little weight gain. Medical treatment with propylthiouracil (PTU) started at age 3 years and was adjusted over time. Total thyroidectomy was performed at age 7 years due to persistent symptoms and increased thyroid hormone levels.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Family history of hyperthyroidism; patient underwent total thyroidectomy at age 7 years due to hyperthyroidism symptoms.
medical_history.family_history: Patient's father diagnosed with hyperthyroidism at age 4; paternal grandmother developed hyperthyroidism in adolescence.
